head.supplied: Melbourne botan Garden, ¶ 12/10/70 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ In reference to the proposed reduction of the employees of the botanic Garden, I have the honor of submitting a list, containing those still engaged here ...

div.p: W70/13816, unit 468, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: end; margin-right: 3.8048in;
font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; text-align: end; margin-right: 3.8048in;

div.p:
In reference to the proposed reduction of the employees of the botanic Garden, I have the honor of submitting a list, containing those still engaged here with a statement of their length of service and the duties allotted to them. I have also the honor to remark, that their work in their different positions is so varied, as to render a reduction according to juniority an impossibility
A minute on M to J. McCulloch, 30 September 1870 (in this edition as 70-09-30d)hadinstructed M to dismiss according to seniority.
, not every man being able to take an other ones work, special knowledge and experience being in each case requisite. In suggesting, what reductions might be made, I beg respectfully to enquire, whether the men indicated as those, with whose services I can best dispense, might not obtain employment in one of the parks under the board of lands and works or in the railway department.
M suggested 'certain arrangements' (register entry; details not known) that enabled all the men to be paid in December: M to J. McCulloch, November 1870 (in this edition as 70-11-00b); W. Odgers to M,7 December 1870; M to J. McCulloch,27 December 1870.
I have the honor to be,
Employés of the Melbourne Botanic Garden

cell.p:
—professional
These names have been bracketed and indicated as 'professional'.
